question:
These questions are based on A.H. Mohammed's The Last Days at Forcados High School.

At the end of term in Forcados High School. Nene was saddled with the responsibility of
options: leading her house in the race
arranging the school hall for dinner

question: Efua was not in the good books of teachers at Forcados High School because
options: the students of Forcados did not like her
she was expelled from her previous school
she bribed the principal before she was admitted
her admission into senior class was unusual

question: In the novel, Ansa looked around glumly when Jimi was engrossed in laughter and chatter because he was
options: distracted by a band playing on the field
given twelve strokes of the cane by the principal

question: Mama Shilifat had an affection for Jimi because she always gave him
options: the courage to do well in his class

question:
Ansa licked his lips and said furtively, look this is between you and me. Jimi would be angry if i told you but his brother is ---- well, we suspect he sometimes sells drugs and...'

From the excerpt above, Ansa was talking to
The speculation amongst the students of Forcados High School was that Jimi was dating
Mr Solade sent Jimi to Ibadan for the holidays in order to
options: save Jimi from Wole's bad influence
heed Jimi's request to stay with his friends
allow Jimi spend some time with his friends
allow Jimi to know more about Ibadan

question: Students refused to sympathize with Efua when drinks spilled on her because
options: she would not accept their sympathy
they planned it to disgrace her

question: Which of the following best describes Mr Mallum?
options: He was a fat, tall man with wimpish behaviour
He was a tall, wiry man with good diction
He was crude, rash and impatient
He was a small, wiry man with odd accent

question: According to the novel, Efua was in Forcados High School because
options: her stepfather was a board member
the school needed her mother's support
of aunt Moni's gift to the school

question:
Jimi and Efua, there's something fishy going on there....
From the exercept above, the expression...something fishy refers to
options: Nene's fear that Efua and Jimi were no longer going out
Nene's fear that Jimi was not determined to jilt Efua
Nene's annoyance that Efua might snatch Jimi from her
Nene's suspicion that Jimi and Efua were having a relationship

question: Seyi Lawal, the head boy of the school was described as someone who
The author uses the novel to portray some of the
Efua's guarded and hostile attitude towards boys could be traced to
options: the teachings she had from her cleric
stories she had heard from her aunt
the experience she had with her stepfather

question: Jimi was very prominent in Forcados High School because he was
options: the son of a great scholar
the only child of his parents

question:
For this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the question.

Mr. Rufus bore the brunt in the last promotion examination.
explanation:
bore the brunt; To suffer the worst part of an unpleasant or problematic situation.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: Mr Rufus failed the examination woefully
Mr Rufus excelled in the examination
Mr. Rufus was excited about the examination
Mr. Rufus toyed with the examination

question:
For this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the question.

My friend is well off nowadays
explanation:
well off; wealthy. (in a favourable situation or circumstances).

There is an explanation video available below.
options: My friend is well known to people

question:
For this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the question.

The retired army officer did a yeoman's service to the nation
explanation:
yeoman service; exceptionally good, useful, or loyal service or assistance. 

There is an explanation video available below.
options: His activity brought disrepute to the nation
His service to the nation was not exemplary
He was showered with the responsibilty of the yeoman
He was very loyal to the nation

question:
For this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the question.

He suddenly found himself in the thick of the situation
explanation:
be in the thick of something means = to be very involved at the busiest or most active stage of a situation or activity

There is an explanation video available below.
options: He did not agree with the situation
He used his experience to settle the sitution
He saved himself out of the situation
He found himself deeply involved in the situation

question:
For this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the question.

Olu and Ado are about to come to blows.
explanation:
come to blows; start fighting after a disagreement.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: They are about to agree with each other
They are about to accept other people's opinion
They are about to hit each other
They are about to disagree with other people's

question:
For this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the question.

By refusing the offer, he has just cut down his own throat
explanation:
what is cut your own throat: to behave in a way that will cause harm 

There is an explanation video available below.
options: He has made a big mistake
He has made the right decision
He has given up on his idea
He has used the Knife on his throat

question:
For this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the question.

These job cuts are just the thin end of the wedge
explanation:
the thin end of the wedge : the beginning of a harmful development:

options: Job cuts are the beginning of unpleasant situations
Job cuts are the beginning of healthy rivalries

question:
For this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the question.

Jumai will do well if she was given a fair crack of the whip.
explanation:
a fair crack of the whip : an equal chance to do something:

options: She would do well if she was given a fair whip
She would excel if she used the whip well
She would do well if she was given equal opportunity
She would do well if she was made to cry

question:
For this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the question.

Her death was a bolt from the blue to us
explanation:
a bolt from the blue; a sudden and unexpected event.

question:
For this question, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the question.

The students were nosing around.
explanation:
Nose around/about something means to try to find out information about someone or something.

Example: A few kids were nosing around.

question:

It is important not to let mistakes blight your life

blight; have a severely detrimental effect on. (a thing that spoils or damages something.)
improve; having become or been made better.

improved; having become or been made better.

question:

It is Iudicrous to suggest that she was a government agent

Iudicrous ; so foolish, unreasonable, or out of place as to be amusing.
sensible; done or chosen in accordance with wisdom or prudence; likely to be of benefit.

The idea makes me cringe

cringe; bend one's head and body in fear or apprehension or in a servile manner.

question:
For this question, choose the option opposite in meaning to the word or phrase in italics

His book was one of those that galvanized democracy
explanation:
galvanized ; shock or excite (someone) into taking action. 
synonyms;  excite, rouse, arouse, awaken, invigorate, fire, fuel, 

dissuade; persuade (someone) not to take a particular course of action.
synonyms; discourage, deter, prevent,

question:
For this question, choose the option opposite in meaning to the word or phrase in italics

He walks in a gawky way

gawky; nervously awkward and ungainly.

graceful; having or showing grace or elegance

question:
For this question, choose the option opposite in meaning to the word or phrase in italics

The nation is in a period of economic flux
explanation:
flux; the action or process of flowing or flowing out.

stability: the condition of being steady and not changing

question:
For this question, choose the option opposite in meaning to the word or phrase in italics

Our son was highly active and exuberant
explanation:

subdued;  (of a person or their manner) quiet and rather reflective or depressed.

question:
For this question, choose the option nearest in meaning to the word or phrase in italics

Mr. Ojo has a fickle character.

fickle ; changing frequently, especially as regards one's loyalties or affections.

question: Bola takes......his father both in appearance and his manner
explanation:
Bola takes after his father both in appearance and his manner

question: .........rich has its own problem
explanation:
Being rich has its own problem.

Being; present participle of be.

question:
For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s)

The doctor listened to my heartbeat with a .........
explanation:
stethoscope; a medical instrument for listening to the action of someone's heart or breathing, typically having a small disc-shaped resonator that is placed against the chest, and two tubes connected to earpieces.

There is an explanation video available below.

question:
For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s)

With strong determination, Adamu was able to .... the problem
explanation:
With strong determination, Adamu was able to surmount the problem

surmount means to overcome (a difficulty or obstacle).

There is an explanation video available below.

question:
For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s)

It is impossible to say whether ......Ola and her sister will be offered jobs by the firm.
explanation:
It is impossible to say whether both Ola and her sister will be offered jobs by the firm.

Both is used for emphasis to refer to two people or things, regarded and identified together.

There is an explanation video available below.

question:
For these questions, choose the option that best complete the gap(s)

He decided to wait for the bus because he had..........
explanation:
He decided to wait for the bus because he had a lot of luggage

The noun luggage can be countable or uncountable. In more general, commonly used, contexts, the plural form will also beluggage. 

There is an explanation video available below.

more lawyers enrolled at the Nigerian Bar last year than this year.

question:
The words in capital letters have the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates.

The car CRUSHED him.
explanation:
In responding to questions on emphatic stress, Interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. This means that, the statement that does not have the emphasized word in it is the correct answer. Option D is the correct answer here because the word ''injure contradicts crushed''.

There is an explanation video available below.

question:
The words in capital letters have the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates.

Lamide is VERY hostile?

In responding to questions on emphatic stress, Interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. Option A is the correct answer here.

There is an explanation video available below.

question:
The words in capital letters have the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates.

My house is a BUNGALOW
explanation:
To answer question on emphatic stress, the sentence that doesn't have the emphatic word becomes the correct answer. From the question, the emphatic stress is the word ''BUNGALOW''. only one option does not have bungalow in it which is option A

There is an explanation video available below.
